subjectDescription: Discover a full suite of online business courses that will allow you to make better business decisions and succeed in today's competitive business world. Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Introduction to Operations Management
headline: Get equipped with relevant skills, strategies and tools to work as an operations expert in this free online course.
description: Operations management is at the heart of every business. It involves making decisions that will guide the activities of any given organisation to its objectives. In this short course, you will study the role and responsibilities of an operations manager. We will discuss subjects that include project management, planning and forecasting. You will also learn about performance management and other significant business strategies. Enrol today!
courseDescription:
Operations management is a critical aspect of business management and in this course, you will discover why. John's Academy has designed these lessons for business-minded individuals and those considering a career in operations to gain essential skills to carry on the trade. We will begin by considering how operations management was introduced into businesses and its historical development. You will learn about project management, the individual elements of the project life cycle and the importance of the critical phases in a project.

Next, we will discuss business development and the elements that makeup succession planning. Discover the importance of flow in the supply chain, procurement and purchasing management as they ensure the smooth delivery of satisfaction to customers. You will also learn about the details of manufacturing and delivery operations. Production scheduling, facilities management and the delivery processes are also sub-topics that we will examine.

Finally, we will review the segments of conflict management, stress management and time management. Discover techniques and strategies that help manage anxiety while supervising your workload efficiently. We will then highlight ethics and morality in the business environment as well as social responsibility. By completing this course, you will have acquired the basic skills to successfully work as part of the operations team in any business environment. Sign up today!

Start Course Now

All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page
slides:
• Learning Outcomes - Operations management

  • By the end of this module, you will be able to:

    • Define operations management
    • Explain the project life cycle, from initiation to completion
    • Define succession planning
    • Differentiate between quality control and quality assurance
    • Discuss Kolb's Learning Cycle
    • Explain the Goal Setting Theory of Motivation
    • List the strategies for coping and reducing stress

  • Lesson Summary - Operations Management

  • In the first topic - Operations Management Essentials, we discussed the points below:

    • Ultimately, operations management is about making decisions that will guide the activities of any given organization to its goal. Some examples of where organizational effort was paramount include: building the Great Wall of China and organizing the Olympic Games.
    • A project is a set of activities with a clear starting point and a definite end; it is headed towards a defined goal and uses a clear set of resources.
    • There are some well-defined stages to go through and understand from the initial idea to signing the project off. There are five stages and they are known as the Project Life Cycle - initiating, planning, controlling, executing, and closing.
    • Business development can be defined as the ideas, initiatives, and activities aimed at making a business better. They also include increasing revenue, growth in business expansion, etc.
    • Business Process Management (BPM) is the way in which a company will refine and improve its procedures. Content management is a key part of BPM and can provide major benefits.
    • Supply Chain management can be crucial to performing better product management and customer satisfaction. The flow of a supply chain relies on good collaboration and communication.
    • Mastering the routines in supply chain management can make the difference between success and failure for a business.
